etymologies: late 19th century. From scientific Latin Acidanthera from ancient Greek ἀκιδ-, ἀκίς pointed object + post-classical Latin anthera, in allusion to the cuspate anthers

definitions: A plant of the genus or former genus Acidanthera (family Iridaceae), which comprises tropical and southern African herbaceous perennials having spikes of hooded fragrant flowers.

notes.text: Acidanthera is now usually regarded as a subsection of the closely related genus Gladiolus.
